claim: If A is 5 years older than B, and B is 10 in 2025, A was 8 in 2010

attacks.text: The calculation assumes B's birthday has already occurred in 2025. If B's birthday is later in 2025, B would still be 9 at the start of 2025.
The original claim specifies B is 10 in 2025, implying the age is valid for the entire year or at the time of measurement, making A1's calculation correct.

supporting.text: A is 5 years older than B, so A was born in 2010 (2015 - 5 = 2010).

attacks.text: A is 5 years older than B, so A was born in 2010 (2015 - 5 = 2010).
If B is 10 in 2025, B was born in 2015 (2025 - 10 = 2015). A is 5 years older than B, so A was born in 2010 (2015 - 5 = 2010). In 2010, A would be 0 years old, not 8.
The claim states 'A was 8 in 2010,' which contradicts the calculation that A was born in 2010 and thus would be 0 years old in 2010.

supporting.text: For A to be 8 in 2010, A would have to be born in 2002 (2010 - 8 = 2002), which contradicts the given age difference.

attacks.text: For A to be 8 in 2010, A would have to be born in 2002 (2010 - 8 = 2002), which contradicts the given age difference.
